alert.note: Alert for Mahoning; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 1:47PM EST until February 19 at 1:36AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mahoning River At Youngstown. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Roads near the river in Girard and Niles in southern Trumbull County inundated. These include First and Second Streets in Niles, and River and Front Streets in Girard. Businesses south of Olive Street in McDonald inundated. Lowland in Mahoning County inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EST Friday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 6.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.9 feet on 05/23/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1200 AM EST.
